intro: Ilyogeton alsinoides, commonly known as the common alsin, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows and along roadsides. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, releasing a mild scent when crushed. Ilyogeton alsinoides is a herbaceous annual that plays a role in supporting local pollinator populations.
